intro: Seseli fedtschenkoanum var. iliense, commonly known as the Ilan Valley seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, often branched stems and small, compound leaves that are typically hairy. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It thrives in rocky or alpine environments, often found in mountainous regions of Central Asia. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
